name: Leuven
fun_fact: Leuven is home to the Oude Markt, nicknamed 'the longest bar in the world' with over 40 bars and 4,000 seats in one rectangular square (174m x 35m)! The city is also the birthplace of Stella Artois (founded 1366), and hosts KU Leuven - the oldest Catholic university in the world, founded in 1425. It's the undisputed capital of Belgian beer culture.

hero_dishes.name: Stoemp
hero_dishes.description: Traditional Flemish mashed potatoes mixed with vegetables (often carrots, leeks, or Brussels sprouts) served with sausage
hero_dishes.origin_story: Classic Belgian comfort food, especially popular in university towns during cold months
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Domus (traditional Flemish dishes), De Klimop near the train station

hero_dishes.name: Stoofvlees (Flemish Beef Stew)
hero_dishes.description: Beef slowly braised in Belgian beer with onions, mustard, and spices, often served with fries
hero_dishes.origin_story: The national dish of Belgium - tender beef cooked for hours in dark Belgian beer creates rich, complex flavors
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Domus (known for excellent stooflees), traditional restaurants around Oude Markt

hero_dishes.name: Vol-au-vent
hero_dishes.description: Puff pastry shell filled with chicken or veal in creamy mushroom sauce
hero_dishes.origin_story: Classic Belgian-French dish, a staple of traditional Flemish cuisine

hero_dishes.name: Game Croquettes
hero_dishes.description: Crispy breaded croquettes filled with game meat (venison, wild boar)
hero_dishes.origin_story: Belgian croquettes are elevated to an art form, especially in university towns with hunting traditions

hero_dishes.name: Belgian Fries (Friet)
hero_dishes.description: Thick-cut potatoes double-fried to perfection, crispy outside and fluffy inside
hero_dishes.origin_story: Belgium invented fries (despite the name 'French fries') - served in paper cones with various sauces
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Frituur stands throughout Leuven, especially around Oude Markt

signature_drinks.name: Stella Artois
signature_drinks.description: World-famous pilsner lager brewed in Leuven since 1366 (under various names)
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At the brewery tour, you can taste it straight from the tank and get the exclusive unfiltered version. The 9.4% Grand Cru is given to tour guests in a presentation case.

signature_drinks.name: Con Domus & Met Domus
signature_drinks.description: House-brewed beers at Domus restaurant - unique to this establishment
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Domus is one of the few restaurants brewing its own beer on-site - try both their flagship brews

signature_drinks.name: Abbey Beers from Park Abbey
signature_drinks.description: Beers from Braxatorium Parcensis at the historic Park Abbey
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: The vaulted cellar taproom at Park Abbey offers the best selection - worth the taxi ride outside town center

signature_drinks.name: Microbrewery Beers
signature_drinks.description: Craft beers from De Coureur and Brouwerij Adept
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Leuven's microbrewery scene is thriving - locals explore these alongside the historic breweries

food_culture_notes: Leuven was once home to 30+ breweries at the start of the last century - beer culture runs deep
Oude Markt has been the city center since 1150 when it received market rights
The 'Barmen's Race' during the Hapje Tapje food festival (August) is the highlight of summer
Students drive the bar culture - with 4,000 seats in Oude Markt alone
De Hoorn restaurant sits on the site of the original Stella Artois brewery - you can drink Stella from the tank among the copper brewhouse vessels
The Stella Artois brewery tour includes underground cellars with oak vats that once hosted orchestra concerts
International visitors always rave about the authentic Belgian atmosphere, food, and beer selection

landmarks: Oude Markt (Old Market Square) - 'longest bar in the world'
Stella Artois Brewery and visitor center
Town Hall (Stadhuis) with ornate Gothic architecture
Park Abbey with Braxatorium Parcensis brewery
De Kotmadam statue (1985) on Oude Markt
atmosphere: Historic brewery copper vessels and oak vats
Annual festivals and concerts (Beleuvenissen every Friday in July)
colors: Stella Artois red and gold branding
unique_modern: Interactive brewery tours at Stella Artois
Contemporary student culture meets medieval history
Craft beer bars alongside traditional establishments
Summer food festivals like Hapje Tapje
